name: Name
theme_introduction: Customize the appearance of Godot Launcher
select_language_note: Select the language for Godot Launcher (does not change the language of Godot)
editor_install_location_note: Choose a location for Editor installs. Existing installs will not be affected.
git_intro: Git is a distributed version control system for managing code changes and collaboration.
vscodeIntro: A fast, extensible code editor with GDScript and .NET support for Godot.
vscodeNotDetectedDesc: Godot Launcher is only able to automatically detect VS Code if it was installed in the PATH. You can instead specify the path to the vs code executable below
selectVsCodePath: Visual Studio Code Path to Executable
updates_note: Configure how Godot Launcher checks for updates
checkUpdate_anewversiontoinstall: is available, restart Godot Launcher to install.
projectlocation_note: Choose a location for new projects. Existing projects will not be affected.
GDLauncherNeedVSCodeNote: Godot Launcher is only able to automatically detect VS Code if it was installed in the PATH. You can instead specify the path to the VS Code executable in the settings.
setupVSCodeAsTextEditor: Set up VS Code as text editor
render.forwardplus.note.3: Can scale to large complex scenes.
waitfordialogtoaddproject: Waiting for dialog to add project...
ChooseGodotLauncherbehaviorforprojects: Choose Godot Launcher behavior for projects.
Ask_for_confirmation_when_removing_proje: Ask for confirmation when removing projects.
Choose_what_GD_Launcher_does_after_launc: Choose what Godot Launcher does after launching a project
settings.editor.symlink_desc: Choose whether project editors use optional symbolic links or stay with local copies.
settings.editor.symlink.note: Use symbolic links for Windows project editors. This stays off by default so you can opt in when you are ready for potential elevation prompts during editor updates.
settings.editor.symlink.warning: Changing this setting does not convert existing project links; it only affects how future editor refreshes behave.
settings.editor.symlink.enable.title: Enable editor symlinks
settings.editor.symlink.disable.title: Disable editor symlinks
settings.editor.symlink.enable.desc.1: When enabled, Godot Launcher links each project to the installed editor instead of copying it.
settings.editor.symlink.enable.desc.2: This keeps disk usage low, but Windows may request administrator approval when new symlinks are created.
settings.editor.symlink.enable.desc.3: Existing projects keep their current local copies until their editor version is changed or reinstalled.
settings.editor.symlink.disable.desc.1: Switch back to local copies to avoid elevation prompts. Godot Launcher will copy the editor files into each project instead.
settings.editor.symlink.disable.desc.2: Existing symlinks remain in place until their editor version is changed or reinstalled.
startup.settings.subheader: Choose what GD Launcher does when your computer starts
startup.autostart.linux_not_supported: Auto start currently is not supported on Linux
